text: Leucopogon oliganthus is a shrub in the family Ericaceae found in Western Australia. It was first described in 1904 by Ernst Georg Pritzel, and the specific epithet, oliganthus, derives from the Greek: oligos ("few" or "scanty") and anthos ("flower") to give an adjective describing the plant as having "few or small flowers". ==References== oliganthus Category:Ericales of Australia Category:Flora of Western Australia Category:Plants described in 1904 Category:Taxa named by Ernst Pritzel
title: Leucopogon oliganthus
